channel.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
channel.description:
As I am sure a lot of you have already read Valve have cancelled their planned E3 event in favour of a "surprise!" event instead. There is a lot of speculation flying about that this might be an unveiling of Half Life Ep 3 (HL3 maybe? lol) However there is always a slight chance no matter how small that this might be Black Mesa related?
I mean how awesome would that actually be! Anyway the original article I read can be found [url='https://www.digitalspy.co.uk/gaming/news/a223049/valve-e3-event-replaced-by-surprise.html']here[/url]. My bets would be on some kind of announcment regarding episode 3? or maybe even something unexpected regarding Portal 2?
Let the speculation commence!

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Floyd:

It’s well known that Lost and Valve have made frequent nods to each other throughout the series. Just wondering if this was one of them and whether it’s something that we can expect in Portal 2?

According to an interview with the lead writer for Portal 1 & 2, the main reason that HL & Portal were connected, was so they could recycle HL2 assets. There’s not going to be much if any more connections between the two than what’s already been established. 10:00

Read full topic

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
I also thought the same thing. You should send Gabe an E-Mail, floyd.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Floyd:

Bumped, because I’m way behind on all of this. It’s a small but strange observation, but did anyone else notice the Smoke Monster sound from Lost at the 12 second mark in this trailer?

https://kotaku.com/5564435/portal-2-trailer-the-bitch-is-back

It’s well known that Lost and Valve have made frequent nods to each other throughout the series. Just wondering if this was one of them and whether it’s something that we can expect in Portal 2?

That was more mechanical than the usual airy sounding “ticka ticka ticka”, though I can see where you could make the connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
uk_sniper:

well known?!

I can imagine valve parodying lost but i doubt that lost would have reciprocated with spy’s and cans of bonk conveniently placed around the island…

TF2 isn’t Valve’s only game, you know. Maybe you’ve heard of this one called Half Life?

So Valve noticed several Half Life references in Lost (such as Jack’s father appearing and disappearing like G-Man, some guys playing HL1 in one episode) and decided to talk to J.J. Abrams. When Abrams said he was a big fan of Half Life, Valve promised to include an easter egg in Episode 2. Which they did.

1280×1024 268 KB

Anyways, the point is it went both ways.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

I was being humorous by pointing out that the original Starcraft was ported to consoles, because apparently it’s such a big deal if Starcraft 2 happens to be ported over as well. Though it’s very unlikely that’ll ever happen.

wouldn’t be a big deal to me, I was just correcting someone’s comparison of Valve’s PS3 port to a hypothetical Blizzard port.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve's E3 Suprise?
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
higgsboson:

So back on topic, this is what happened at E3:

  1. Valve announced the Portal 2 event
  2. They cancelled the Portal 2 event
  3. They announced a surprise
  4. They announced Portal 2

Could someone point me to the location of the surprise? Other than “well we didn’t expect them to release Portal 2 after cancelling the Portal 2 event”.

well we didn’t expect them to release Portal 2 after cancelling the Portal 2 event.

No kidding.

Read full topic

item.description:
